itemDescription: British sport shooter and Conservative politician (1865-1953)

wikipedia_page.main: Sir Philip Wigham Richardson, 1st Baronet,  (26 January 1865 – 23 November 1953) was a British sport shooter and Conservative politician. He was the first son of John Wigham Richardson, the shipbuilder from Newcastle upon Tyne. He also competed at the 1908 Summer Olympics and the 1912 Summer Olympics.
